intro: Dorotheanthus flos-solis, commonly known as the sunflower of the sea, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy inflorescences. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces bright yellow flowers with a distinctive orange center. It thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is adapted to salty, coastal environments. Dorotheanthus flos-solis is often found in dunes and along the edges of tidal marshes, where it plays a role in stabilizing sand and preventing erosion.
